title: Firing in Punjab: Army officer shoots openly in Sangrur injuring 9 civilians
text:
Firing in Punjab: Army officer shoots openly in Sangrur injuring 9 civilians By Mohammed Uzair Shaikh on October 20, 2015 at 3:35 PM Comments 
Chandigarh, Oct 20: Amid the escalating tension over the desecration of Sikh holy book in Punjab, a shocking incident was reported from Sangrur region, where an army office reportedly fired rounds in mid-air injuring nine civilians. The victims were immediately rushed to medical aid. On being alerted by the locals, Punjab Police personnel arrived at the spot and cordoned off the region. 
The army personnel who resorted to indiscriminate firing has been identified as Jagdeep. Police has surrounded his location, and have initiated the operation to apprehend him. (ALSO READ: Sikh holy book desecration: 3 accused arrested; Punjab chief minister Parkash Singh Badal calls emergency meet) 
The incident could further vitiate the atmosphere in the state which is already tense. Sikh groups have unitedly launched protest against the government led by Shiromani Akali Dal and BJP who are accused of shielding the saffron extremists who are allegedly behind the desecration of Guru Granth Sahib in six villages across the state. They include â€“ Kotkapura near Faridkot, Baath near Taran, Mishriwala near Ferozepur, Kohrian near Sangrur and Ghawaddi near Ludhiana. 
Punjab chief minister Parkash Singh Badal called for a emergency meeting on Tuesday of cabinet ministers and senior bureacrats to take stock of the situation. Five troops of paramilitary forces have been deployed in the region.
